messages.content: How can I add my own collection primitives?
You can add your own collection primitives by defining them in a `.json` file and placing it in the `ComfyUI-Static-Primitives/collection_primitives/` directory.
In what file format should custom collection primitive groups be defined?
Custom collection primitive groups should be defined in a `.json` format.
Where should custom collection primitive files be placed?
Custom collection primitive files should be placed in the `ComfyUI-Static-Primitives/collection_primitives/` directory.
What is the structure of a collection primitive definition?

A collection primitive definition structure consists of key-value pairs with the key representing the display name of the node and the value being a list of strings that correspond to the options for the node's dropdown.
What is an example of a default collection primitive file in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
An example of a default collection primitive file is `samplers_and_schedulers.json`, which contains definitions for scheduler and sampler nodes.
What is the significance of avoiding duplicate keys across collection primitive files?
Avoiding duplicate keys is crucial because if any duplicate keys are found while loading, all definitions with that key will be ignored.
What does ComfyUI-Static-Primitives add to ComfyUI?
ComfyUI-Static-Primitives adds Static Primitives to ComfyUI to work with reroute nodes.
How do I install ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
To install ComfyUI-Static-Primitives, clone the repo inside your custom_nodes folder using `git clone https://github.com/80sVectorz/ComfyUI-Static-Primitives.git`.
What is the purpose of the static primitives in ComfyUI?
The static primitives in ComfyUI are intended to simplify the workflow by providing predefined types that work with reroutes, reducing wire spaghetti.
What types of primitives are included in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
ComfyUI-Static-Primitives includes primitives for all the basic data types and also a collection type system with default types such as samplers and schedulers.
Can I add my own collection primitives to ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?

Yes, you can add your own collection primitives to ComfyUI-Static-Primitives by following the instructions found in the README file located at https://github.com/80sVectorz/ComfyUI-Static-Primitives/blob/main/collection_primitives/collection_primitives_readme.md.
Are there any installation instructions for ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
Yes, the installation instructions for ComfyUI-Static-Primitives are to clone the repo inside your custom_nodes folder using `git clone https://github.com/80sVectorz/ComfyUI-Static-Primitives.git`.
